snippet: Labor is in decline, and the income gap is widening. That’s not a coincidence. We’ve forgotten what necessary institutions unions are.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column argues that many well-educated liberals have turned their backs on unions in recent decades, trend that has coincided with the declining power of organized labor; cites Timothy Noah book The Great Divergence, which calls for a revival of the labor movement as a way to combat income inequality.
lead_paragraph: Labor is in decline, and the income gap is widening. That’s not a coincidence. We’ve forgotten what necessary institutions unions are.
